arts.sum: QPR’s poor run continued with a 3-1 defeat at Stoke. Here’s how we rated each Rangers player. Paul Nardi: 7 Produced good saves to keep the score down and was unlucky when the second goal came via the loose ball after a fine save from the Frenchman. arts.ttl: Mark Robins salutes 'joke of a goal' in vital Stoke City win over QPR
arts.sum: "But other than that, I've got to say that is a really, really good level of performance and we want to see that for the rest of this season and beyond." I can see, visibly, his level has gone up and thankfully he's carried that into today's game, creating chances and scoring a really good goal.

arts.ttl: Cifuentes explains decisons after QPR loss – and admits he wishes he could change them
arts.sum: Marti Cifuentes admitted regretting some of his decisions after QPR slumped to another defeat. Rangers’ 3-1 loss at Stoke means they gone six matches without a win – a run which has included five defeats – and have lost eight of their past 11 games. With his already limited options up front further reduced by […] The post Cifuentes explains decisons after QPR loss – and admits he wishes he could change them appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Stoke beat QPR to ease relegation fears
arts.sum: Junior Tchamadeu scored his first goal for Stoke as they eased their relegation fears in the Sky Bet Championship with a 3-1 victory over QPR.

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs QPR as winger revelation with new trick in massive win
arts.sum: Stoke seemed in absolute control from the moment they stepped out on the pitch and were 2-0 to the good by half-time thanks to strikes from Bae Junho and Junior Tchamadeu. Stoke had assumed control in the first half thanks in large to the brilliant combination play of Tchamadeu and Manhoef down the right.

arts.ttl: Junior Tchamedeu scores as struggling Stoke secure vital victory over QPR
arts.sum: The Potters managed to put more daylight between themselves and the relegation zone.

arts.ttl: Stoke City team news vs QPR as Mark Robins makes three changes
arts.sum: It’s games of football when we’ve got to pick points up, which we’ve been close to doing. Sam Gallagher starts his first game in nearly three months as Mark Robins makes three changes to his Stoke City starting line-up for a home game against Queens Park Rangers.

arts.ttl: Stoke v QPR line-ups: No Frey, Varane and Morgan return for Rangers
arts.sum: QPR will play without a recognised striker this afternoon as Michael Frey did not travel with the squad. The fit-again Karamoko Dembele starts, with Lucas Andersen and Paul Smyth supporting him in attack. With Steve Cook out injured, Morgan Fox partners Ronnie Edwards at the back. Jonathan Varane returns in midfield, as does Kieran Morgan. […] The post Stoke v QPR line-ups: No Frey, Varane and Morgan return for Rangers appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Stoke City vs QPR live - Team news from the bet365 Stadium - Stoke-on-Trent Live
arts.sum: It is tight down at the bottom and the Potters went into this weekend just one point above the dotted line - but there are at least eight clubs who are panicking and Mark Robins would ideally like to drag a couple more into the mix over the next few weeks. We will have all the news, action and reaction as it happens.

arts.ttl: Boss buoyed by 'biggest turnaround' in his time at Stoke City despite 'huge blow'
arts.sum: Stoke fired eight blanks in 17 league games between late November and mid-February and Robins, who took charge on New Year’s Day, wasn’t helped that 11-goal top scorer Tom Cannon was soon whisked back to Leicester to be sold on to Sheffield United. Mark Robins believes that getting Stoke City even looking like they can score goals has been one of the most important turnarounds in his first three months as manager.
